alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 15 at 10:09PM CST until February 15 at 11:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CST FOR WESTERN BENTON...DELAWARE...NORTHWESTERN ADAIR AND NORTHEASTERN CHEROKEE COUNTIES... At 1009 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Jay to 4 miles southeast of Scraper, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...65 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Siloam Springs... Jay... Gentry... Gravette... Decatur... West Siloam Springs... Colcord... Kansas... Highfill... Watts... Oaks... Springtown... Maysville... Leach... Scraper... Twin Oaks... Lake Francis... Fairmount... Lake Eucha State Park... Gallitin... HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
